Player History
Had first career hit (double) on 7/19/1966, off Bill Singer (BOS)...
Hit first career homerun on 7/24/1966, off Diego Segui (KCA)...
Injured on 8/3/1966 with a Inflamed Back Muscle, out for 1-2 weeks...
Drove in 6 runs against Texas on 6/16/1967...
Drove in 6 runs against Texas on 6/3/1969...
Traded from New York (A) to Chicago (N) on 1/31/1970 (Going to CHC: 3B T. Conigliaro, LF C. Yastrzemski, P T. Wilshusen. Going to NYY: C J. Ferguson, 2B D. Lopes, 1B J. Young, P E. Stephenson)...
Signed as a free agent by California on 2/3/1975 to a 1-year deal worth $1,123,456 per year...
Released by California on 2/5/1975...
Signed as a free agent by Chicago (N) on 2/22/1975 to a 4-year deal worth $2,000,000 per year...
Won World Series with Chicago (N) in 1975...
Signed as a free agent by Chicago (A) on 2/2/1979 to a 2-year deal worth $900,000 per year...
Injured on 4/29/1979 with a Inflamed Back Muscle, out for one week...
Signed as a free agent by Chicago (N) on 2/4/1981 to a 2-year deal worth $480,000 per year...
Had 5 hits with 2 RBI against Los Angeles on 4/13/1981...
